title.narrative: Food Security Program with Global Links - Nicaragua - 2015

description.narrative: Global Links is a medical relief and development organization dedicated to supporting health improvement initiatives in resource-poor communities and promoting environmental stewardship in the US healthcare system. Since 1989 Global Links has worked to redirect still-useful materials away from US landfills to support public health programs in targeted communities throughout the Western Hemisphere. In Nicaragua, Global Links focuses its efforts in the Rio San Juan region, as well as the Autonomous Regions along the Atlantic Coast, because these areas experience higher maternal and infant mortality rates than the rest of the country. Through Global Links’ partnership with the Nicaraguan Ministry of Health and the Pan American Health Organization, Stop Hunger Now meals will be provided to maternal clinics where women from very remote regions travel to give birth. With the Stop Hunger Now meals, these women will have sufficient nutrition while awaiting their child’s birth. The increase in births attended by trained medical personnel is expected to decrease maternal and infant mortality.
